Alicia Keys.passage: Alicia Augello Cook (born January 25, 1981), known professionally as Alicia Keys, is an American singer-songwriter, musician, record producer, actress, and philanthropist. A classically-trained pianist, Keys began composing songs by age 12 and was signed at 15 years old by Columbia Records. After disputes with the label, she signed with Arista Records, and later released her debut album, Songs in A Minor, with J Records in 2001. The album was a commercial success, selling over 12 million copies worldwide and earning Keys five Grammy Awards in 2002. Keys' second studio album, The Diary of Alicia Keys (2003), was also a critical and commercial success, debuting at number one on the Billboard 200 and selling over 8 million copies worldwide. The album earned her four more Grammy Awards in 2005. Her third album, As I Am (2007), debuted at number one on the Billboard 200 and sold over 7 million copies worldwide, earning her two more Grammy Awards in 2009. Keys' fourth album, The Element of Freedom (2009), debuted at number two on the Billboard 200 and sold over 4 million copies worldwide. In addition to her music career, Keys has also acted in films and television shows, including The Nanny Diaries (2007), The Secret Life of Bees (2008), and Empire (2015). She has also served as a coach on the singing competition show The Voice. Keys is also known for her philanthropic work, particularly in the areas of HIV/AIDS and education. In 2003, she co-founded Keep a Child Alive, a non-profit organization that provides treatment and support to children and families affected by HIV/AIDS in Africa and India. She has also been involved in various education initiatives, including the We Are Here Movement, which aims to empower and inspire people to take action on social issues. Throughout her career, Keys has sold over 65 million records worldwide and has won numerous awards, including 15 Grammy Awards, 17 NAACP Image Awards, and 9 Billboard Music Awards. She has been named one of Time magazine's 100 most influential people in the world and has been inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame.

Beyonce.passage: Beyoncé Giselle Knowles-Carter, known mononymously as Beyoncé, is an American singer, songwriter, record producer, dancer, and actress. Born and raised in Houston, Texas, Beyoncé performed in various singing and dancing competitions as a child. She rose to fame in the late 1990s as the lead singer of Destiny's Child, one of the best-selling girl groups of all time. Beyoncé's debut solo album, Dangerously in Love (2003), established her as a solo artist worldwide, earned five Grammy Awards, and featured the Billboard Hot 100 number-one singles "Crazy in Love" and "Baby Boy". Following the disbandment of Destiny's Child in 2006, she released her second solo album, B'Day, which contained the hits "Irreplaceable" and "Beautiful Liar". Beyoncé also ventured into acting, with a Golden Globe-nominated performance in Dreamgirls (2006), and starring roles in The Pink Panther (2006) and Obsessed (2009). Her critically acclaimed fifth studio album, Beyoncé (2013), was distinguished from previous releases by its experimental production and exploration of darker themes. In 2018, she released Everything Is Love, a collaborative album with her husband, rapper Jay-Z, as The Carters. The album was released exclusively on Tidal, a streaming service that Jay-Z co-owns. Beyoncé is one of the world's best-selling music artists, having sold over 118 million records worldwide. She is the most nominated woman in the history of the Grammy Awards, with 28 wins. In 2014, she became the highest-paid black musician in history and was listed among Time's 100 most influential people in the world for a second year in a row. Forbes ranked her as the most powerful female in entertainment on their 2015 and 2017 lists, and in 2016, she occupied the sixth place for Time's Person of the Year. With the release of Lemonade (2016), Beyoncé became the first and only musical act in Billboard chart history to debut at number one with their first six solo studio albums.

Bruno Mars.passage: Peter Gene Hernandez, known professionally as Bruno Mars, is an American singer, songwriter, record producer, and multi-instrumentalist. He was born on October 8, 1985, in Honolulu, Hawaii, to a family of musicians. His father was a percussionist and his mother was a singer and dancer. Mars grew up surrounded by music and began performing at a young age. Mars started his music career as a songwriter, writing songs for other artists such as Flo Rida, Brandy, and Sean Kingston. He gained recognition for his songwriting skills and was signed to Atlantic Records in 2009. He released his debut album, Doo-Wops & Hooligans, in 2010, which included hit singles such as "Just the Way You Are" and "Grenade". The album was a commercial success, selling over six million copies worldwide and earning Mars seven Grammy nominations. Mars continued his success with his second album, Unorthodox Jukebox, which was released in 2012. The album included hit singles such as "Locked Out of Heaven" and "When I Was Your Man". The album won the Grammy Award for Best Pop Vocal Album in 2014. Mars has also collaborated with other artists, including Mark Ronson on the hit single "Uptown Funk", which won the Grammy Award for Record of the Year in 2016. He has also collaborated with Beyoncé, Adele, and Ed Sheeran, among others. In addition to his music career, Mars has also appeared in films and television shows, including Honeymoon in Vegas and Saturday Night Live. He has also performed at the Super Bowl halftime show twice, in 2014 and 2016. Mars is known for his versatile musical style, which incorporates elements of pop, R&B, funk, soul, and reggae. He is also known for his energetic live performances and his showmanship. He has won numerous awards throughout his career, including 11 Grammy Awards, and has sold over 200 million records worldwide. Mars has also been involved in philanthropic work, including supporting music education programs and disaster relief efforts. He has donated millions of dollars to various charities and organizations, including the Grammy Foundation, the American Red Cross, and the Hawaii Community Foundation. Overall, Bruno Mars is a talented musician and performer who has achieved great success in the music industry.

Ed Sheeran.passage: Ed Sheeran is an English singer-songwriter and musician who was born on February 17, 1991, in Halifax, West Yorkshire, England. He grew up in Framlingham, Suffolk, and began playing guitar at a young age. Sheeran's musical career began in 2004 when he moved to London to pursue his passion for music. He started performing in small venues and released his first EP, The Orange Room, in 2005. In 2011, Sheeran released his debut album, + (pronounced "plus"), which was a commercial success and received critical acclaim. The album featured hit singles such as "The A Team" and "Lego House" and earned Sheeran several awards, including two Brit Awards and an Ivor Novello Award. Sheeran's second album, x (pronounced "multiply"), was released in 2014 and featured the hit singles "Sing" and "Thinking Out Loud." The album was also a commercial success and earned Sheeran several more awards, including a Grammy Award for Best Pop Solo Performance for "Thinking Out Loud." Sheeran's third album, ÷ (pronounced "divide"), was released in 2017 and featured hit singles such as "Shape of You" and "Castle on the Hill." The album was another commercial success and earned Sheeran several more awards, including two Grammy Awards for Best Pop Solo Performance for "Shape of You" and Best Pop Vocal Album for ÷. In addition to his successful music career, Sheeran has also made several appearances in film and television. He appeared in the 2019 film Yesterday and has made guest appearances on shows such as Game of Thrones and The Simpsons. Sheeran is known for his unique blend of folk, pop, and hip-hop music, as well as his heartfelt and personal lyrics. He has been praised for his ability to connect with his audience and for his dedication to his craft. Sheeran has also been involved in various philanthropic efforts, including supporting charities such as East Anglia's Children's Hospices and the Elton John AIDS Foundation. Overall, Ed Sheeran is a talented musician and songwriter who has achieved great success in the music industry. His unique style and heartfelt lyrics have earned him a dedicated fan base and numerous awards and accolades.

Lady Gaga.passage: Lady Gaga, born Stefani Joanne Angelina Germanotta, is an American singer, songwriter, and actress. She was born on March 28, 1986, in New York City. Gaga began playing the piano at the age of four and wrote her first song at the age of 13. She attended the Convent of the Sacred Heart, a private all-girls Catholic school in Manhattan, where she continued to hone her musical skills. In 2008, Gaga released her debut album, "The Fame," which included hit singles such as "Just Dance" and "Poker Face." The album was a commercial success, reaching number one in several countries and earning her a Grammy Award for Best Dance Recording. Gaga's unique style and theatrical performances quickly made her a pop culture icon. Over the years, Gaga has continued to release successful albums, including "Born This Way" and "Joanne." She has also ventured into acting, appearing in films such as "A Star is Born" and "Machete Kills." In addition to her music and acting career, Gaga is also known for her philanthropic work. She has been an advocate for LGBTQ+ rights and has worked with organizations such as the Born This Way Foundation, which she founded in 2012 to support the mental health and well-being of young people. Gaga's fashion sense has also been a major part of her public persona. She is known for her bold and avant-garde outfits, which often incorporate elements of performance art. In 2010, she famously wore a dress made entirely of raw meat to the MTV Video Music Awards, sparking controversy and discussion about the role of fashion in pop culture. John Legend.passage: John Legend, born John Roger Stephens on December 28, 1978, is an American singer, songwriter, pianist, and actor. He was born and raised in Springfield, Ohio, and began playing the piano at the age of four. Legend attended the University of Pennsylvania, where he studied English with an emphasis on African-American literature. Legend's music career began in 2004 with the release of his debut album, "Get Lifted," which featured the hit singles "Used to Love U" and "Ordinary People." The album earned him three Grammy Awards, including Best New Artist, Best R&B Album, and Best Male R&B Vocal Performance for "Ordinary People." Since then, Legend has released six more studio albums, including "Once Again," "Evolver," "Love in the Future," "Darkness and Light," "A Legendary Christmas," and "Bigger Love." He has collaborated with numerous artists, including Kanye West, Alicia Keys, and The Roots. In addition to his music career, Legend has also acted in several films and television shows, including "Soul Men," "La La Land," and "Jesus Christ Superstar Live in Concert," for which he won an Emmy Award for Outstanding Variety Special (Live). Legend is also known for his philanthropic work, particularly in the areas of education and criminal justice reform. He founded the Show Me Campaign, which focuses on improving education for underprivileged children, and he serves on the board of directors for the Harlem Village Academies, a network of charter schools in New York City. Overall, John Legend is a multi-talented artist who has made a significant impact in the music industry and beyond. His soulful voice, piano skills, and socially conscious lyrics have earned him numerous accolades and a dedicated fan base.

Taylor Swift.passage: Taylor Alison Swift is an American singer-songwriter. She was born on December 13, 1989, in Reading, Pennsylvania. Swift moved to Nashville, Tennessee, at the age of 14 to pursue a career in country music. She signed with the independent label Big Machine Records and became the youngest artist ever signed by the Sony/ATV Music publishing house. Swift's self-titled debut album was released in 2006 and peaked at number five on the Billboard 200. The album's lead single, "Tim McGraw," became a top 10 hit on the country charts. Swift's second album, Fearless, was released in 2008 and became the best-selling album of that year in the United States. The album won four Grammy Awards, including Album of the Year, making Swift the youngest person ever to win the award. Swift's third album, Speak Now, was released in 2010 and debuted at number one on the Billboard 200. The album's lead single, "Mine," became a top 10 hit on the Billboard Hot 100. Swift's fourth album, Red, was released in 2012 and debuted at number one on the Billboard 200. The album's lead single, "We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together," became Swift's first number one hit on the Billboard Hot 100. Swift's fifth album, 1989, was released in 2014 and marked a departure from her country music roots. The album's lead single, "Shake It Off," became a number one hit on the Billboard Hot 100. The album won three Grammy Awards, including Album of the Year. Swift's sixth album, Reputation, was released in 2017 and debuted at number one on the Billboard 200. The album's lead single, "Look What You Made Me Do," became Swift's fifth number one hit on the Billboard Hot 100. Swift has won numerous awards throughout her career, including 11 Grammy Awards, 32 American Music Awards, and 23 Billboard Music Awards. She is known for her narrative songwriting style, which often draws from her personal experiences. Swift has also been involved in various philanthropic efforts, including donating to disaster relief efforts and supporting education initiatives. In addition to her music career, Swift has also acted in films and television shows. She made her acting debut in the 2010 romantic comedy Valentine's Day and later appeared in the 2014 science fiction film The Giver.

Adele.passage: Adele Laurie Blue Adkins MBE, known professionally as Adele, is an English singer-songwriter. She was born on May 5, 1988, in Tottenham, London, England. Adele's music is characterized by her powerful vocals, soulful lyrics, and emotional depth. She has been praised for her ability to connect with her audience through her music, and her songs have resonated with millions of people around the world. Adele's career began in 2006 when she signed with XL Recordings after a friend posted her demo on Myspace. Her debut album, "19," was released in 2008 and was a critical and commercial success. The album featured the hit singles "Chasing Pavements" and "Hometown Glory," and earned Adele two Grammy Awards. In 2011, Adele released her second album, "21," which became a global phenomenon. The album featured the hit singles "Rolling in the Deep," "Someone Like You," and "Set Fire to the Rain," and earned Adele six Grammy Awards, including Album of the Year. "21" has sold over 31 million copies worldwide, making it one of the best-selling albums of all time. Adele's third album, "25," was released in 2015 and was another commercial success. The album featured the hit singles "Hello" and "When We Were Young," and earned Adele five Grammy Awards. "25" has sold over 22 million copies worldwide. In addition to her music career, Adele has also made several appearances in film and television. She appeared in the 2012 film "Skyfall," singing the theme song for the James Bond film of the same name. She also appeared as a musical guest on "Saturday Night Live" and "The Ellen DeGeneres Show." Adele has been recognized for her contributions to music with numerous awards and honors. She has won a total of 15 Grammy Awards, including Album of the Year for "21" and "25." In 2013, she was awarded an MBE (Member of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire) for services to music. Despite her success, Adele has remained grounded and humble. She has been open about her struggles with anxiety and stage fright, and has spoken about the importance of mental health. She has also been an advocate for various charitable causes, including the Grenfell Tower fire in London and the fight against poverty.

Justin Timberlake.passage: Justin Timberlake is an American singer, songwriter, actor, and record producer. He was born on January 31, 1981, in Memphis, Tennessee, and raised in a Baptist household. Timberlake began his career as a child actor on the television show "The Mickey Mouse Club" and later rose to fame as a member of the boy band NSYNC. In 2002, Timberlake launched his solo career with the release of his debut album, "Justified," which featured hit singles such as "Cry Me a River" and "Rock Your Body." The album earned Timberlake two Grammy Awards and established him as a major force in the music industry. Timberlake's second album, "FutureSex/LoveSounds," was released in 2006 and featured the hit singles "SexyBack," "My Love," and "What Goes Around... Comes Around." The album was a critical and commercial success, earning Timberlake another two Grammy Awards. In addition to his music career, Timberlake has also found success as an actor. He has appeared in films such as "The Social Network," "Friends with Benefits," and "Trolls." He has also hosted and appeared on numerous television shows, including "Saturday Night Live" and "The Ellen DeGeneres Show." Timberlake has been recognized for his philanthropic work, including his support of the Shriners Hospitals for Children and the Memphis Rock 'n' Soul Museum. He has also been involved in various political causes, including supporting Barack Obama's presidential campaign in 2008. Throughout his career, Timberlake has sold over 32 million albums and 56 million singles worldwide, making him one of the best-selling music artists of all time. He has won ten Grammy Awards, four Emmy Awards, and numerous other accolades. Timberlake continues to be a major force in the entertainment industry, with his music and acting careers showing no signs of slowing down.

Shawn Mendes.passage: Shawn Mendes is a Canadian singer, songwriter, and model who rose to fame in 2013 with his cover of Justin Bieber's "As Long as You Love Me" on the social media platform Vine. Born on August 8, 1998, in Toronto, Ontario, Mendes was raised in a Portuguese family and began playing guitar at the age of 13. He gained a following on Vine by posting six-second covers of popular songs, which led to him being discovered by artist manager Andrew Gertler. In 2014, Mendes released his debut single "Life of the Party," which debuted at number 24 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart, making him the youngest artist to debut in the top 25. He then released his debut studio album, "Handwritten," in 2015, which debuted at number one on the Billboard 200 chart and included the hit singles "Stitches" and "Something Big." The album was certified platinum in the United States and Canada. Mendes continued his success with his second studio album, "Illuminate," which was released in 2016 and debuted at number one on the Billboard 200 chart. The album included the hit singles "Treat You Better" and "Mercy" and was also certified platinum in the United States and Canada. In 2018, Mendes released his self-titled third studio album, which debuted at number one on the Billboard 200 chart and included the hit singles "In My Blood" and "Lost in Japan." The album was also certified platinum in the United States and Canada. Mendes has received numerous awards and nominations throughout his career, including three Juno Awards, eight iHeartRadio MMVAs, and two American Music Awards. He has also been named one of Time magazine's 100 most influential people in the world in 2018 and 2019. Aside from his music career, Mendes has also worked as a model, appearing in campaigns for Calvin Klein and Emporio Armani. He has also been involved in various philanthropic efforts, including supporting organizations such as Pencils of Promise and SickKids Foundation. Overall, Shawn Mendes has become one of the most successful and influential young artists in the music industry, with his powerful vocals, relatable lyrics, and charismatic personality captivating audiences around the world.

Ariana Grande.passage: Ariana Grande-Butera, known professionally as Ariana Grande, is an American singer, songwriter, and actress. She began her career in 2008 in the Broadway musical 13, before playing the role of Cat Valentine in the Nickelodeon television series Victorious (2010–2013) and in the spinoff Sam & Cat (2013–2014). She has also appeared in other theatre and television roles, and has lent her voice to animated television and films. Grande's music career began in 2011 with the soundtrack Music from Victorious. In 2013, she released her first studio album Yours Truly, which entered atop the US Billboard 200. The album's lead single, "The Way", opened in the top 10 of the Billboard Hot 100, with critics comparing her wide vocal range to that of Mariah Carey. Grande's second studio album, My Everything (2014), also entered at number one in the US, and contained the hit singles "Problem" and "Break Free". With the singles "Bang Bang" and "Love Me Harder" from the album, she spent 34 consecutive weeks in the top 10 of the Billboard Hot 100, and had the most top 10 singles of any artist in 2014. Her third studio album, Dangerous Woman (2016), debuted at number two on the Billboard 200, and its title track became her first top-five single on the Hot 100. The album also spawned the hit singles "Side to Side" and "Into You". In 2018, Grande released her fourth studio album, Sweetener, which debuted at number one on the Billboard 200 and spawned the hit singles "No Tears Left to Cry" and "God Is a Woman". Her fifth studio album, Thank U, Next (2019), also debuted at number one on the Billboard 200, with its title track becoming her first number-one single on the Hot 100. Throughout her career, Grande has received numerous accolades, including two Grammy Awards, one Brit Award, three Billboard Music Awards, and three MTV Europe Music Awards. Time magazine named her one of the 100 most influential people in the world in 2019, and Forbes included her on their annual list of highest-paid women in music in 2020. She has amassed over 200 million followers on social media, and has been named the most followed woman on Instagram.

Billie Eilish.passage: Billie Eilish Pirate Baird O'Connell (born December 18, 2001) is an American singer-songwriter. She first gained public attention in 2015 with her debut single "Ocean Eyes", which went viral across various social media platforms. Eilish's debut EP, Don't Smile at Me (2017), reached the top 15 in the US, UK, Canada, and Australia. Eilish's debut studio album, When We All Fall Asleep, Where Do We Go? (2019), debuted atop the Billboard 200 and became the best-performing album of 2019 in the US. It also reached number one in the UK. The album contains six Billboard Hot 100 top 40 singles, including "Bad Guy", which became her first number-one single in the US. Eilish has received numerous accolades, including seven Grammy Awards, two American Music Awards, two Guinness World Records, three MTV Video Music Awards, and one Brit Award. Eilish was born and raised in Los Angeles, California. She was homeschooled and joined the Los Angeles Children's Chorus at age eight. Her parents, Maggie Baird and Patrick O'Connell, are both actors. Eilish's older brother, Finneas O'Connell, is also a musician and producer who has co-written and produced much of her music. Eilish's music is often described as dark and introspective, with themes of depression, suicide, and heartbreak. She has cited artists such as Tyler, the Creator, Lana Del Rey, and Avril Lavigne as influences. Eilish's fashion sense, which often includes oversized clothing and neon hair, has also garnered attention and praise. Eilish has been vocal about her support for various social and political causes, including climate change, gun control, and mental health awareness. She has also been open about her struggles with Tourette syndrome and synesthesia. Despite her young age, Eilish has already made a significant impact on the music industry and has been praised for her unique sound and style. She continues to be a prominent figure in popular culture and is considered one of the most influential artists of her generation.

Harry Styles.passage: Harry Styles is an English singer, songwriter, and actor who rose to fame as a member of the boy band One Direction. Born on February 1, 1994, in Redditch, Worcestershire, Styles grew up in Holmes Chapel, Cheshire, where he attended Holmes Chapel Comprehensive School. He developed an interest in music at a young age and began performing in school productions and local talent shows. In 2010, Styles auditioned for the seventh season of the British singing competition show The X Factor. Although he was eliminated as a solo artist, he was brought back to form a group with four other contestants, which became One Direction. The group finished in third place but went on to sign a record deal with Syco Music and release their debut album, Up All Night, in 2011. One Direction quickly became one of the biggest boy bands in the world, with a string of hit singles and albums. Styles was known for his distinctive voice, charming personality, and signature fashion sense, which often included skinny jeans, boots, and a range of hats and scarves. He also co-wrote several of the group's songs, including "Story of My Life" and "Night Changes." In 2016, One Direction announced that they would be taking a hiatus to pursue solo projects. Styles signed a solo deal with Columbia Records and released his debut single, "Sign of the Times," in April 2017. The song was a critical and commercial success, reaching the top of the charts in several countries and earning Styles comparisons to rock legends like David Bowie and Freddie Mercury. Styles' self-titled debut album was released in May 2017 and showcased his versatility as a songwriter and performer. The album featured a mix of rock, pop, and folk influences, with standout tracks like "Two Ghosts" and "Kiwi." Styles embarked on a world tour in support of the album, which included sold-out shows at venues like Madison Square Garden and The O2 Arena. In addition to his music career, Styles has also pursued acting. He made his film debut in the war drama Dunkirk in 2017, directed by Christopher Nolan. Styles played a British soldier named Alex and received praise for his performance, with some critics suggesting that he could have a future in acting. Styles has also been involved in various philanthropic efforts, including supporting charities like Comic Relief and the London Lesbian and Gay Switchboard.

Katy Perry.passage: Katheryn Elizabeth Hudson, known professionally as Katy Perry, is an American singer, songwriter, and television personality. She was born on October 25, 1984, in Santa Barbara, California, and raised in a conservative family. Perry began her music career singing gospel music in church as a child and later pursued a career in secular music. In 2008, Perry released her second studio album, "One of the Boys," which included the hit singles "I Kissed a Girl" and "Hot n Cold." The album was a commercial success, reaching number nine on the Billboard 200 and selling over five million copies worldwide. Perry's third studio album, "Teenage Dream," was released in 2010 and included the hit singles "California Gurls," "Teenage Dream," and "Firework." The album debuted at number one on the Billboard 200 and became the first album by a female artist to produce five number-one singles on the Billboard Hot 100. Perry has won numerous awards throughout her career, including four Guinness World Records, five American Music Awards, a Brit Award, and a Juno Award. She has also been nominated for 13 Grammy Awards, including Album of the Year for "Teenage Dream" and Best Pop Solo Performance for "Roar." In addition to her music career, Perry has also appeared as a judge on the singing competition show "American Idol" and has been a guest judge on "RuPaul's Drag Race." She has also acted in films and television shows, including "The Smurfs" and "How I Met Your Mother." Perry is known for her colorful and eccentric fashion sense, often incorporating bright colors and bold patterns into her outfits. She has also been an advocate for various causes, including LGBTQ+ rights, education, and environmentalism. Overall, Katy Perry has become one of the most successful and influential pop stars of the 21st century, with over 100 million records sold worldwide and a massive following on social media. Her music and persona have inspired countless fans around the world, and she continues to be a major force in the entertainment industry.

Dua Lipa.passage: Dua Lipa is an English singer, songwriter, and model. She was born on August 22, 1995, in London, England, to Albanian parents. Lipa's parents moved to London in the 1990s, and she grew up in the city's northwest district of Hampstead. She attended Sylvia Young Theatre School, where she studied singing, acting, and dance. Lipa began her music career by posting covers of popular songs on YouTube. In 2015, she signed a contract with Warner Music Group and released her debut single, "New Love." The song received positive reviews and helped Lipa gain a following. She followed up with the singles "Be the One" and "Last Dance," which also received critical acclaim. In 2017, Lipa released her self-titled debut album, which included the hit singles "New Rules" and "IDGAF." The album was a commercial success, reaching the top 10 in several countries, including the UK and the US. Lipa won several awards for her work on the album, including two Brit Awards and a Grammy Award. Lipa's music is often described as pop, with influences from R&B, hip hop, and electronic dance music. Her lyrics often focus on themes of love, heartbreak, and female empowerment. She has cited artists such as Nelly Furtado, Pink, and Christina Aguilera as influences on her music. In addition to her music career, Lipa has also worked as a model. She has appeared in campaigns for brands such as Adidas and Yves Saint Laurent. She has also been featured in several fashion magazines, including Vogue and Elle. Lipa is known for her distinctive fashion sense, often wearing bold and colorful outfits. She has been praised for her style by fashion critics and has been named a fashion icon by several publications. Overall, Dua Lipa has become one of the most successful and influential pop stars of her generation. With her powerful voice, catchy songs, and unique style, she has captured the hearts of fans around the world.

Khalid.passage: Khalid Donnel Robinson, known mononymously as Khalid, is an American singer and songwriter. He was born on February 11, 1998, in Fort Stewart, Georgia, and raised in various locations including Fort Campbell in Kentucky, Fort Drum in Watertown, New York, and Heidelberg in Germany. Khalid's mother is of African American descent, while his father is of African American and Native American descent. Khalid first gained popularity in 2016 with his debut single "Location", which peaked at number 16 on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart and was certified quadruple platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA). His debut studio album, American Teen, was released in March 2017 and debuted at number nine on the US Billboard 200 chart. The album was certified platinum by the RIAA and earned Khalid a nomination for Best Urban Contemporary Album at the 60th Annual Grammy Awards. In April 2019, Khalid released his second studio album, Free Spirit, which debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200 chart. The album was supported by the singles "Talk" and "Better", both of which reached the top 20 of the US Billboard Hot 100 chart. Free Spirit was certified platinum by the RIAA and earned Khalid a nomination for Best Urban Contemporary Album at the 62nd Annual Grammy Awards. Khalid has collaborated with several artists throughout his career, including Billie Eilish, Halsey, Marshmello, and Ed Sheeran. He has also been recognized for his philanthropic efforts, including his support for the American Foundation for Suicide Prevention and his partnership with Reebok to donate shoes to underprivileged youth. Khalid's music has been described as a blend of R&B, pop, and hip hop, with lyrics that often touch on themes of love, relationships, and self-discovery. He has been praised for his soulful vocals and relatable songwriting, and has been compared to artists such as Frank Ocean and The Weeknd. As of 2021, Khalid has sold over 50 million records worldwide and has won several awards, including four Billboard Music Awards, one MTV Video Music Award, and one American Music Award. He continues to be a prominent figure in the music industry and a voice for his generation.

Sam Smith.passage: Samuel Frederick Smith, better known as Sam Smith, is an English singer-songwriter who rose to fame in 2012 after being featured on Disclosure's hit single "Latch". Born on May 19, 1992, in London, Smith grew up in a musical family and began singing at a young age. He attended the Youth Music Theatre UK and studied music at the University of Westminster before dropping out to pursue his music career. In 2013, Smith released his debut single "Lay Me Down" which reached number 46 on the UK Singles Chart. However, it was his second single "Money on My Mind" that became a commercial success, reaching number one on the UK Singles Chart and earning him a Brit Award for Critics' Choice. Smith's debut studio album, "In the Lonely Hour", was released in 2014 and became a massive success, selling over 12 million copies worldwide and earning him four Grammy Awards, including Best New Artist and Record of the Year for "Stay with Me". Smith's music is known for its emotional depth and vulnerability, often exploring themes of heartbreak, love, and self-discovery. His soulful voice and powerful lyrics have earned him a dedicated fanbase and critical acclaim. In addition to his solo work, Smith has collaborated with a number of artists, including Disclosure, Calvin Harris, and Mary J. Blige. Despite his success, Smith has been open about his struggles with mental health and body image issues. He has used his platform to advocate for LGBTQ+ rights and has been a vocal supporter of various charities, including War Child UK and the Elton John AIDS Foundation. In 2019, Smith came out as non-binary and announced that they would be using they/them pronouns. They have since become a prominent advocate for gender non-conformity and have used their music to explore themes of gender identity and expression. Overall, Sam Smith is a talented and influential artist who has made a significant impact on the music industry. With their powerful voice and honest lyrics, they have touched the hearts of millions and continue to inspire fans around the world.

Despite her success, Lizzo has faced criticism and backlash for her body positivity message, with some accusing her of promoting obesity. The Weeknd.passage: The Weeknd, whose real name is Abel Makkonen Tesfaye, is a Canadian singer, songwriter, and record producer. He was born on February 16, 1990, in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. The Weeknd first gained widespread recognition in 2010 with his mixtape "House of Balloons," which was released independently on the internet. The mixtape received critical acclaim and helped establish The Weeknd as a rising star in the music industry. In 2011, The Weeknd released two more mixtapes, "Thursday" and "Echoes of Silence," which further solidified his reputation as a talented artist. His unique blend of R&B, pop, and electronic music, combined with his introspective and often dark lyrics, set him apart from other artists in the genre. In 2012, The Weeknd signed with Republic Records and released his debut studio album, "Kiss Land," which debuted at number two on the US Billboard 200 chart. The album received mixed reviews from critics but was still a commercial success. The Weeknd's next album, "Beauty Behind the Madness," was released in 2015 and featured the hit singles "Can't Feel My Face" and "The Hills." The album was a massive success, debuting at number one on the Billboard 200 and earning The Weeknd two Grammy Awards. The Weeknd's third album, "Starboy," was released in 2016 and featured collaborations with Daft Punk, Lana Del Rey, and Kendrick Lamar. The album was another commercial and critical success, debuting at number one on the Billboard 200 and earning The Weeknd another Grammy Award. In 2018, The Weeknd released his EP "My Dear Melancholy," which debuted at number one on the Billboard 200. Throughout his career, The Weeknd has been praised for his unique sound and style, as well as his ability to evolve and experiment with different genres. He has also been recognized for his powerful live performances and his willingness to tackle difficult and personal subject matter in his music. In addition to his music career, The Weeknd has also dabbled in acting, appearing in the films "Uncut Gems" and "The Suicide Squad." He has also been involved in various philanthropic efforts, including donating $1 million to COVID-19 relief efforts and supporting the Black Lives Matter movement.

Drake.passage: Drake is a Canadian rapper, singer, songwriter, actor, and entrepreneur. He was born on October 24, 1986, in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. His real name is Aubrey Drake Graham. Drake first gained recognition as an actor on the teen drama television series Degrassi: The Next Generation in the early 2000s. However, he later transitioned into music and released his debut mixtape, Room for Improvement, in 2006. Drake's music career took off in 2009 with the release of his third mixtape, So Far Gone. The mixtape featured the hit single "Best I Ever Had," which peaked at number two on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart. Drake's debut studio album, Thank Me Later, was released in 2010 and debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200 chart. The album featured collaborations with artists such as Kanye West, Jay-Z, and Alicia Keys. Drake's second studio album, Take Care, was released in 2011 and won the Grammy Award for Best Rap Album in 2013. The album featured hit singles such as "Headlines," "The Motto," and "Take Care" featuring Rihanna. Drake's third studio album, Nothing Was the Same, was released in 2013 and debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200 chart. The album featured hit singles such as "Started from the Bottom" and "Hold On, We're Going Home" featuring Majid Jordan. Drake has since released several more successful albums, including Views (2016), Scorpion (2018), and Certified Lover Boy (2021). He has also collaborated with numerous artists, including Future, Lil Wayne, and Rihanna. Drake has won four Grammy Awards, six American Music Awards, and 27 Billboard Music Awards, among other accolades. In addition to his music career, Drake has also ventured into entrepreneurship. He is the founder of the record label OVO Sound and the clothing line OVO (October's Very Own). Drake has also invested in several businesses, including the whiskey brand Virginia Black and the esports organization 100 Thieves. Drake's influence on the music industry and popular culture is undeniable. He has been praised for his ability to blend different genres and styles, as well as his introspective and emotional lyrics. Drake's impact on hip-hop and R&B has been compared to that of Michael Jackson and Prince.

Chris Brown.passage: Chris Brown is an American singer, songwriter, dancer, and actor. He was born on May 5, 1989, in Tappahannock, Virginia. Brown's parents were both involved in the music industry, and he grew up listening to soul, hip-hop, and R&B music. He began singing in his church choir and was discovered by a local talent agent when he was just 13 years old. Brown's self-titled debut album was released in 2005 and featured the hit single "Run It!" which topped the Billboard Hot 100 chart. The album went on to sell over two million copies in the United States and was certified double platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA). In 2007, Brown released his second album, "Exclusive," which featured the hit singles "Kiss Kiss" and "With You." The album debuted at number four on the Billboard 200 chart and was certified double platinum by the RIAA. Brown's personal life has been the subject of much media attention. In 2009, he pleaded guilty to felony assault charges for physically assaulting his then-girlfriend, singer Rihanna. He was sentenced to five years of probation and six months of community service. Despite the controversy surrounding his personal life, Brown has continued to release successful albums and singles. His 2011 album, "F.A.M.E.," won a Grammy Award for Best R&B Album, and his 2014 album, "X," debuted at number two on the Billboard 200 chart. In addition to his music career, Brown has also pursued acting. He has appeared in several films, including "Stomp the Yard," "This Christmas," and "Takers." Brown has been praised for his vocal abilities and his dance skills, which have been compared to those of Michael Jackson. He has also been criticized for his behavior offstage, including his legal troubles and his controversial social media posts. Despite the ups and downs of his career and personal life, Brown remains a popular and influential figure in the music industry. He has sold over 140 million records worldwide and has won numerous awards, including a Grammy Award, 14 BET Awards, and four Billboard Music Awards.

Selena Gomez.passage: Selena Marie Gomez is an American singer, actress, and producer. Born on July 22, 1992, in Grand Prairie, Texas, she began her career as a child actress on the children's television series Barney & Friends. In 2007, she rose to fame playing the lead role of Alex Russo in the Disney Channel series Wizards of Waverly Place. Gomez's music career began in 2008 when she formed the band Selena Gomez & the Scene. The band released three studio albums and produced hit singles such as "Naturally," "Love You Like a Love Song," and "Who Says." In 2013, Gomez released her first solo album, Stars Dance, which debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200 chart. She has since released two more solo albums, Revival (2015) and Rare (2020), both of which received critical acclaim and commercial success. Aside from her music career, Gomez has also acted in numerous films and television shows. She has starred in movies such as Ramona and Beezus, Monte Carlo, and Spring Breakers. In 2017, she executive produced the Netflix series 13 Reasons Why, which received both praise and controversy for its depiction of sensitive topics such as suicide and sexual assault. Gomez has also been involved in various philanthropic efforts throughout her career. She has worked with organizations such as UNICEF, the Ryan Seacrest Foundation, and the Lupus Research Alliance. In 2017, she underwent a kidney transplant due to complications from lupus, a chronic autoimmune disease she has been open about battling. Throughout her career, Gomez has received numerous awards and nominations for her work in music and acting. She has won an American Music Award, a Billboard Women in Music award, and an Emmy for her work on Wizards of Waverly Place. She has also been recognized for her impact on social media, with Time magazine naming her one of the most influential people on the internet in 2017 and 2018. Gomez's personal life has also been the subject of media attention. She has been in high-profile relationships with musicians such as Justin Bieber and The Weeknd. She has also been open about her struggles with mental health and has spoken out about the importance of seeking help and destigmatizing mental illness. Overall, Selena Gomez has established herself as a multi-talented artist and philanthropist, using her platform to advocate for important causes and inspire her fans.

Halsey.passage: Halsey is an American singer, songwriter, and actress. Born Ashley Nicolette Frangipane on September 29, 1994, in Edison, New Jersey, she began playing music at a young age and eventually taught herself how to play the guitar and piano. She adopted the stage name Halsey, which is an anagram of her first name, and began posting her music on social media platforms. In 2014, Halsey released her debut EP, Room 93, which received critical acclaim and helped her gain a following. She signed with Astralwerks in 2015 and released her debut studio album, Badlands, later that year. The album was a commercial success, debuting at number two on the Billboard 200 and spawning hit singles such as "New Americana" and "Colors." Halsey's music is known for its confessional lyrics and blend of genres, including pop, alternative, and electropop. She has cited influences such as Alanis Morissette, Nirvana, and Tupac Shakur. Her second studio album, Hopeless Fountain Kingdom, was released in 2017 and featured collaborations with artists such as Quavo and Lauren Jauregui. The album debuted at number one on the Billboard 200 and was certified platinum. In addition to her music career, Halsey has also acted in films and television shows. She made her acting debut in the 2018 film, A Star is Born, and has also appeared in the television series, American Horror Story. She has been open about her struggles with bipolar disorder and has used her platform to advocate for mental health awareness. Halsey has received numerous accolades for her music, including several Grammy nominations and wins at the MTV Video Music Awards and Billboard Music Awards. She has also been recognized for her activism, including her support of the LGBTQ+ community and her involvement in political causes such as the Women's March. With her unique sound and honest lyrics, Halsey has become a prominent figure in the music industry and a voice for a new generation.

Camila Cabello.passage: Karla Camila Cabello Estrabao, known professionally as Camila Cabello, is a Cuban-American singer, songwriter, and actress. She was born on March 3, 1997, in Cojimar, Cuba, and raised in Miami, Florida. Cabello rose to fame as a member of the girl group Fifth Harmony, which was formed on the second season of the American version of The X Factor in 2012. In December 2016, Cabello announced her departure from Fifth Harmony to pursue a solo career. She released her debut solo single, "Crying in the Club," in May 2017, which was followed by her debut studio album, Camila, in January 2018. The album debuted at number one on the Billboard 200 chart and spawned the hit singles "Havana" and "Never Be the Same." Nicki Minaj.passage: Onika Tanya Maraj-Petty, known professionally as Nicki Minaj, is a Trinidadian-American rapper, singer, songwriter, actress, and model. Born in Saint James, Port of Spain, and raised in Queens, New York City, she gained public recognition after releasing the mixtapes Playtime Is Over (2007), Sucka Free (2008), and Beam Me Up Scotty (2009). Minaj's debut studio album, Pink Friday (2010), peaked at number one on the US Billboard 200 and spawned the hit singles "Super Bass" and "Starships". Her second album, Pink Friday: Roman Reloaded (2012), also topped the chart and its lead single, "Starships", peaked at number five on the Billboard Hot 100. The album also spawned the hit singles "Pound the Alarm" and "Va Va Voom". Minaj's third studio album, The Pinkprint (2014), was preceded by its second single, "Anaconda", which peaked at number two on the Hot 100 and is her highest-charting single in the United States to date. The album also spawned the hit singles "Only" and "Truffle Butter". Throughout her career, Minaj has received numerous accolades, including six American Music Awards, 11 BET Awards, four MTV Video Music Awards, four Billboard Music Awards, a Billboard Women in Music Rising Star Award, and 10 Grammy Award nominations. She has sold over 100 million records worldwide, making her one of the best-selling music artists of all time. In addition to her music career, Minaj has ventured into acting, with appearances in films such as The Other Woman (2014) and Barbershop: The Next Cut (2016), and television shows such as American Idol and Saturday Night Live. She has also been a judge on the twelfth season of American Idol and a coach on the twelfth season of The Voice. Minaj has been noted for her unique vocal style, which includes rapping in a distinctive voice and singing in a variety of styles, including pop, R&B, and hip hop. She has also been praised for her bold and often controversial lyrics, which touch on topics such as sexuality, feminism, and race. Minaj has been a prominent advocate for the LGBTQ+ community and has been recognized for her philanthropic work, including her support of various charities and organizations.

Cardi B.passage: Cardi B is an American rapper, songwriter, and actress. Born Belcalis Marlenis Almánzar on October 11, 1992, in The Bronx, New York City, she grew up in a low-income family and worked as a stripper before gaining fame as a rapper. She first gained attention for her viral videos on social media, which led to her appearance on the VH1 reality show Love & Hip Hop: New York in 2015. Cardi B's debut single "Bodak Yellow" was released in 2017 and became a massive hit, reaching number one on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart. The song's success led to her debut studio album, Invasion of Privacy, which was released in 2018 and debuted at number one on the Billboard 200 chart. The album was critically acclaimed and earned Cardi B a Grammy Award for Best Rap Album in 2019. In addition to her music career, Cardi B has also made appearances in films and television shows, including the 2019 film Hustlers and the Netflix series Rhythm + Flow. She has also been a vocal advocate for political and social issues, including supporting the Black Lives Matter movement and speaking out against police brutality. Cardi B's personal life has also been the subject of media attention, particularly her relationship with fellow rapper Offset, whom she married in 2017 and has since filed for divorce from. The couple has one child together, a daughter named Kulture Kiari Cephus. Despite controversy and criticism surrounding some of her lyrics and public persona, Cardi B has become one of the most successful and influential female rappers of her generation. She has been praised for her authenticity and willingness to speak openly about her experiences, and has inspired a new generation of young women in the music industry.

SZA.passage: SZA, whose real name is Solána Imani Rowe, is an American singer, songwriter, and record producer. She was born on November 8, 1989, in St. Louis, Missouri, and raised in Maplewood, New Jersey. SZA began making music in her teenage years, and in 2012, she self-released her debut EP, See.SZA.Run. The EP caught the attention of Top Dawg Entertainment, a record label based in California, and SZA signed with them in 2013. SZA's debut studio album, Ctrl, was released in 2017 to critical acclaim. The album explores themes of self-discovery, relationships, and personal growth, and features collaborations with Travis Scott, James Fauntleroy, and Isaiah Rashad. Ctrl was a commercial success, peaking at number three on the US Billboard 200 and earning SZA four Grammy nominations. SZA's music is often described as a blend of R&B, soul, and alternative hip-hop. Her lyrics are introspective and personal, and she has been praised for her unique vocal style and ability to convey emotion through her music. SZA has cited a wide range of musical influences, including Björk, Lauryn Hill, and Joni Mitchell. In addition to her music career, SZA has also been involved in activism and social justice work. She has spoken out about issues such as police brutality and the Black Lives Matter movement, and has used her platform to raise awareness and advocate for change. Overall, SZA has established herself as a talented and influential artist in the music industry. Her music has resonated with audiences around the world, and she continues to push boundaries and explore new creative avenues.

Ella Mai.passage: Ella Mai Howell, known professionally as Ella Mai, is a British singer and songwriter. She was born on November 3, 1994, in London, England. Mai grew up in a musical family and began singing at a young age. She attended the British and Irish Modern Music Institute in London, where she studied music and developed her skills as a songwriter. Mai gained popularity in 2016 with her debut EP, Time, which featured the hit single "She Don't." The song received widespread acclaim and helped Mai gain a following on social media. In 2017, she signed with DJ Mustard's label, 10 Summers Records, and released her second EP, Ready. The EP featured the hit single "Boo'd Up," which became a viral sensation and peaked at number five on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart. In 2018, Mai released her self-titled debut album, which featured collaborations with artists such as Chris Brown, John Legend, and H.E.R. Mai's success continued with the release of her single "Trip," which also peaked in the top 20 on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart. Mai's music is known for its soulful R&B sound and relatable lyrics. She has cited artists such as Lauryn Hill, Brandy, and Destiny's Child as influences on her music. Mai has also been praised for her live performances, which showcase her powerful vocals and stage presence. In addition to her music career, Mai has also been involved in philanthropic work. She has partnered with organizations such as the American Cancer Society and the Make-A-Wish Foundation to raise awareness and funds for various causes. Overall, Ella Mai has established herself as a rising star in the music industry with her soulful sound and relatable lyrics. Mai continues to tour and release new music, and her fans eagerly anticipate what she will do next.

Lil Nas X.passage: Lil Nas X, born Montero Lamar Hill, is an American rapper, singer, and songwriter. He was born on April 9, 1999, in Lithia Springs, Georgia. Lil Nas X gained fame in 2019 with his viral hit "Old Town Road," which blended country and hip-hop music. The song became a cultural phenomenon and spent a record-breaking 19 weeks at the top of the Billboard Hot 100 chart. Before his breakthrough success, Lil Nas X had been releasing music independently on SoundCloud and YouTube. He had also worked as a freelance graphic designer and had dropped out of college to pursue music full-time. "Old Town Road" was initially released independently in December 2018, but it gained traction on the social media app TikTok, where users created videos using the song's catchy chorus. The song's success led to a major-label record deal with Columbia Records, and Lil Nas X released his debut EP, "7," in June 2019. The EP featured collaborations with artists such as Cardi B and Travis Barker. Lil Nas X's music has been described as a fusion of various genres, including hip-hop, country, and pop. In addition to his music, Lil Nas X has been praised for his openness about his sexuality. In June 2019, he came out as gay on Twitter, becoming one of the few openly gay rappers in the mainstream music industry. He has since been an advocate for LGBTQ+ rights and has used his platform to raise awareness about issues affecting the community. Lil Nas X has also been recognized for his fashion sense and has been featured in campaigns for brands such as Calvin Klein and Christian Cowan. He has been known to wear bold and colorful outfits, often incorporating elements of cowboy and western wear into his looks. Despite his relatively short career, Lil Nas X has already made a significant impact on the music industry and popular culture. He has won numerous awards, including two Grammy Awards, and has been praised for his unique sound and style. With his continued success, Lil Nas X is poised to be a major force in the music industry for years to come.

It has also put pressure on the Dutch government to change its policies towards undocumented migrants. However, the movement has faced opposition from some politicians and members of the public who believe that undocumented migrants should be deported. Despite the challenges they face, the members of the We Are Here Movement remain committed to their cause. The movement continues to grow and evolve, as more and more people join the fight for migrant rights in the Netherlands.

American Red Cross..passage: The American Red Cross (ARC), also known as The American National Red Cross, is a humanitarian organization that provides emergency assistance, disaster relief, and education inside the United States. The organization offers services such as blood donation, disaster response, health and safety training, support to military families, and international services. The American Red Cross was founded in 1881 by Clara Barton and has since become one of the most recognized and respected humanitarian organizations in the world. The organization is funded by donations from individuals, corporations, and the government, and relies heavily on the work of volunteers to carry out its mission.

Suffolk..passage: Suffolk is an East Anglian county of historic origin in England. It has borders with Norfolk to the north, Cambridgeshire to the west and Essex to the south. The North Sea lies to the east. The county town is Ipswich; other important towns include Lowestoft, Bury St Edmunds, and Felixstowe, one of the largest container ports in Europe. The county is low-lying with very few hills, and is largely arable land with the wetlands of the Broads in the north. The Suffolk Coast and Heaths are an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. By the fifth century, the Angles (after whom East Anglia and England are named) had established control of the region. The Angles later became the "East Saxons", from which "Essex" and "Middlesex" derive. Suffolk and several adjacent areas became the kingdom of East Anglia, which later merged with Mercia and then Wessex. Suffolk was originally divided into four separate Quarter Sessions divisions. In 1860, the number of divisions was reduced to two. The eastern division was administered from Ipswich and the western from Bury St Edmunds. Under the Local Government Act 1888, the two divisions were made the separate administrative counties of East Suffolk and West Suffolk; Ipswich became a county borough. A few Essex parishes were also added to Suffolk: Ballingdon-with-Brundon and parts of Haverhill and Kedington. On 1 April 1974, under the Local Government Act 1972, East Suffolk, West Suffolk, and Ipswich were merged to form the unified county of Suffolk.

London..passage: London is the capital and largest city of England and the United Kingdom. Standing on the River Thames in southeastern England, London has been a major settlement for two millennia. Londinium was founded by the Romans. The City of London, London's ancient core and financial centre—an area of just 1.12 square miles (2.9 km2) and colloquially known as the Square Mile—retains boundaries that closely follow its medieval limits. The adjacent City of Westminster has for centuries been the location of much of the national government. Thirty-one additional boroughs north and south of the river also comprise modern London. The London region is governed by the mayor of London and the London Assembly.

Stefani Joanne Angelina Germanotta..passage: Stefani Joanne Angelina Germanotta, known professionally as Lady Gaga, is an American singer, songwriter, and actress. She is known for her unconventionality, provocative work, and visual experimentation. She began performing as a teenager, singing at open mic nights and acting in school plays. She studied at Collaborative Arts Project 21, through New York University's Tisch School of the Arts, before dropping out to pursue a career in music. When Def Jam Recordings canceled her contract, she worked as a songwriter for Sony/ATV Music Publishing, where Akon helped her sign a joint deal with Interscope Records and his own label KonLive Distribution in 2007. Gaga rose to prominence the following year with her debut studio album, The Fame, and its chart-topping singles "Just Dance" and "Poker Face". The album was later reissued to include the EP The Fame Monster (2009), which yielded the successful singles "Bad Romance", "Telephone", and "Alejandro". Gaga's second full-length album, Born This Way (2011), explored electronic rock and techno-pop and debuted atop the US Billboard 200 with more than one million copies sold in its first week. Its title track became the fastest-selling song on the iTunes Store with over a million downloads in less than a week. Gaga experimented with EDM on her third studio album, Artpop (2013), which reached number one in the US and included the single "Applause". Her collaborative jazz album with Tony Bennett, Cheek to Cheek (2014), and her soft rock-influenced fifth studio album, Joanne (2016), also topped the US charts. During this period, Gaga ventured into acting, playing leading roles in the miniseries American Horror Story: Hotel (2015–2016), for which she received a Golden Globe Award for Best Actress, and the critically acclaimed musical drama A Star Is Born (2018), for which she was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Actress. Gaga has sold 124 million records as of 2021, making her one of the best-selling music artists of all time. She has also won numerous awards, including 12 Grammy Awards, an Academy Award, a BAFTA Award, three Brit Awards, and 15 MTV Video Music Awards. Time magazine named her one of the 100 most influential people in the world in 2010 and 2019.

Manhattan..passage: Manhattan is the most densely populated borough of New York City, its economic and administrative center, and its historical birthplace. The borough is coextensive with New York County, one of the original counties of the U.S. state of New York. The borough consists mostly of Manhattan Island, bounded by the Hudson, East, and Harlem rivers; several small adjacent islands; and Marble Hill, a small neighborhood now on the U.S. mainland, physically connected to the Bronx and separated from the rest of Manhattan by the Harlem River. Manhattan Island is divided into three informally bounded components, each aligned with the borough's long axis: Lower, Midtown, and Upper Manhattan. Manhattan has been described as the cultural, financial, media, and entertainment capital of the world, and the borough hosts the United Nations Headquarters. Anchored by Wall Street in the Financial District of Lower Manhattan, New York City has been called both the most economically powerful city and the leading financial center of the world, and Manhattan is home to the world's two largest stock exchanges by total market capitalization: the New York Stock Exchange and NASDAQ. Many multinational media conglomerates are based in Manhattan, and the borough has been the setting for numerous books, films, and television shows. Manhattan real estate has since become among the most expensive in the world, with the value of Manhattan Island, including real estate, estimated to exceed US$3 trillion in 2013; median residential property sale prices in Manhattan approximated US$1,600 per square foot ($17,000/m2) as of 2018, with Fifth Avenue in Midtown Manhattan commanding the highest retail rents in the world, at US$3,000 per square foot ($32,000/m2) in 2017.

Red..passage: Red is a color at the end of the visible spectrum of light, next to orange and opposite violet. It has a dominant wavelength of approximately 625–740 nanometers. It is a primary color in the RGB color model and the CMYK color model, and is the complementary color of cyan. Reds range from the brilliant yellow-tinged scarlet and vermillion to bluish-red crimson, and vary in shade from the pale red pink to the dark red burgundy. The red sky at sunset results from Rayleigh scattering, while the red color of the Grand Canyon and other geological features is caused by hematite or red ochre, both forms of iron oxide. Iron oxide also gives the red color to the planet Mars. The red color of blood comes from protein hemoglobin, while ripe strawberries, red apples and reddish autumn leaves are colored by anthocyanins. Red pigment made from ochre was one of the first colors used in prehistoric art. The Ancient Egyptians and Mayans colored their faces red in ceremonies; Roman generals had their bodies colored red to celebrate victories. It was also an important color in China, where it was used to color early pottery and later the gates and walls of palaces. In the Renaissance, the brilliant red costumes for the nobility and wealthy were dyed with kermes and cochineal. The 19th century brought the introduction of the first synthetic red dyes, which replaced the traditional dyes. Red became the color of revolution; Soviet Russia adopted a red flag following the Bolshevik Revolution in 1917, later followed by China, Vietnam, and other communist countries. Today, red is commonly associated with love, passion, anger, and warning signs.

qae_pairs.explanation: The Grand Canyon is known for its red color, which is caused by hematite or red ochre, both forms of iron oxide, as stated in the passage.

Baptist..passage: Baptists are a group of Protestant Christians who subscribe to a theology of believer's baptism (as opposed to infant baptism), salvation through faith alone, scripture alone as the rule of faith and practice, and the autonomy of the local church. Baptists are one of the largest Protestant denominations and are found in many countries around the world. The Baptist tradition originated in the early 17th century in England and quickly spread to the American colonies. Today, there are many different Baptist denominations, each with their own distinct beliefs and practices. Despite these differences, Baptists share a commitment to evangelism, missions, and social justice.

The film also explores the legal battles that ensued between Zuckerberg and his former friends and co-founders, Eduardo Saverin and the Winklevoss twins. Shriners Hospitals for Children..passage: Shriners Hospitals for Children is a network of 22 non-profit medical facilities across North America. Children with orthopedic conditions, burns, spinal cord injuries, and cleft lip and palate are eligible for care and receive all services in a family-centered environment, regardless of the patients' ability to pay. Shriners Hospitals for Children is known for providing pediatric specialty care, innovative research, and outstanding medical education. The hospitals are owned and operated by Shriners International, a fraternity based in the United States. The organization was founded in 1922 and has since treated over 1.4 million children. Shriners Hospitals for Children is committed to improving the lives of children and their families by providing the highest quality care in a compassionate and collaborative environment.

Japan..passage: Japan is an island country in East Asia, located in the northwest Pacific Ocean. It is bordered by the Sea of Japan to the west and the Pacific Ocean to the east, and spans from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and Taiwan in the south. Japan is composed of 6,852 islands, with the largest being Honshu, Hokkaido, Kyushu, and Shikoku. The capital and largest city is Tokyo, with other major cities including Yokohama, Osaka, and Nagoya. Japan is known for its rich history, culture, and technological advancements, and is the world's third-largest economy by nominal GDP and fourth-largest by purchasing power parity. The country has a population of approximately 126 million people, making it the world's tenth-most populous country. Japan is also known for its unique cuisine, including sushi, ramen, and tempura, as well as its traditional arts such as kabuki and ukiyo-e.

SickKids Foundation..passage: The SickKids Foundation is a Canadian charitable organization that raises funds on behalf of The Hospital for Sick Children (SickKids) in Toronto, Ontario. The foundation's mission is to improve the health and well-being of children in Canada and around the world. Since its inception in 1972, the foundation has raised over $3 billion in support of SickKids, making it one of the largest children's hospitals in the world. The funds raised by the foundation are used to support research, education, and patient care at SickKids, as well as to fund capital projects and equipment purchases. The foundation also supports a number of community-based initiatives aimed at improving the health and well-being of children and families in Canada. The SickKids Foundation is governed by a volunteer board of directors and is supported by a staff of over 200 employees. The foundation relies on the generosity of donors, volunteers, and corporate partners to achieve its mission and to continue to provide world-class care to children in need.

Nickelodeon..passage: Nickelodeon is an American pay television network aimed at children and adolescents. It was launched on December 1, 1977, as the first cable channel for children. The channel's programming consists of original first-run television series, theatrically released and original made-for-cable movies, and select other third-party programming. Its programming runs from Sunday through Fridays from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m., and Saturdays from 7:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. (Eastern and Pacific Time). It is primarily aimed at children and adolescents aged 2–17. The channel was originally owned by Warner-Amex Satellite Entertainment, a joint venture between Warner Communications and American Express; Warner later bought out American Express's share in 1984. In 1986, Nickelodeon launched the first edition of the Nickelodeon Kids' Choice Awards. The network has had a relatively successful history in terms of its original programming, which has helped it become one of the most popular cable channels in the United States.

Mariah Carey..passage: Mariah Carey is an American singer, songwriter, actress, and record producer. She was born on March 27, 1969, in Huntington, New York. Carey rose to fame in the early 1990s with her self-titled debut album, which spawned four number-one singles on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart. She has since released 15 studio albums and has sold over 200 million records worldwide, making her one of the best-selling music artists of all time. Carey's vocal range and melismatic singing style have been praised by critics and fans alike. She has been dubbed the "Queen of Christmas" for her popular holiday songs, including "All I Want for Christmas Is You," which has become a modern-day Christmas classic. Carey has won five Grammy Awards, 19 World Music Awards, and 10 American Music Awards, among other accolades. In addition to her music career, Carey has also acted in films and television shows, including "Precious" and "Empire." She has also been a judge on the singing competition shows "American Idol" and "The Voice." Throughout her career, Carey has been known for her diva persona and extravagant lifestyle. She has been married twice and has two children. Despite facing personal and professional challenges, Carey has remained a beloved and influential figure in the music industry.

Instagram..passage: Instagram is a photo and video sharing social networking service owned by Facebook, Inc. It was created by Kevin Systrom and Mike Krieger, and launched in October 2010 exclusively on iOS. A version for Android devices was released a year and half later, in April 2012, followed by a feature-limited website interface in November 2012, and apps for Windows 10 Mobile and Windows 10 in April 2016 and October 2016 respectively. The app allows users to upload photos and videos to the service, which can be edited with various filters, and organized with tags and location information. An account's posts can be shared publicly or with pre-approved followers. Users can browse other users' content by tags and locations, and view trending content. Users can "like" photos, and follow other users to add their content to a feed. The service was originally distinguished by only allowing content to be framed in a square (1:1) aspect ratio with 640 pixels to match the display width of the iPhone 4, 4s, 5, 5s and SE. In 2015, these restrictions were eased with an increase to 1080 pixels. The service also added messaging features, the ability to include multiple images or videos in a single post, as well as "Stories"—similar to its main competitor Snapchat—which allows users to post photos and videos to a sequential feed, with each post accessible by others for 24 hours each. As of January 2019, the Stories feature is used by 500 million users daily.

Despite his achievements, O'Connell's life was marked by tragedy and hardship. He struggled with alcoholism and financial difficulties throughout his career, and was forced to flee Spain in 1939 following the victory of Franco's forces in the Civil War. O'Connell spent the rest of his life in poverty, working odd jobs and living in obscurity. It was only after his death in 1959 that his contributions to football were fully recognized, with tributes pouring in from around the world. Today, O'Connell is remembered as one of the greatest Irish footballers and managers of all time, and a true pioneer of the sport.

Warner Music Group..passage: Warner Music Group (WMG) is an American multinational entertainment and record label conglomerate headquartered in New York City. WMG operates through numerous subsidiaries and divisions, including Warner Records, Atlantic Records, Elektra Records, Parlophone Records, Rhino Entertainment, Warner Music Nashville, and Warner Chappell Music, among others. In addition to its record label operations, WMG also has a significant presence in music publishing, with Warner Chappell Music being one of the world's largest music publishers. The company also has a growing presence in the live music and touring industry, with its acquisition of concert promoter and ticketing company Songkick in 2017. WMG has a long and storied history, dating back to its founding in 1958 as Warner Bros. Records. Over the years, the company has been home to some of the most influential and iconic artists in music history, including Frank Sinatra, The Beatles, Led Zeppelin, Prince, Madonna, and many others. Today, WMG continues to be a major force in the music industry, with a diverse and talented roster of artists and a commitment to innovation and creativity.

He was also a pioneer in the use of non-European cultural influences in fashion, incorporating elements of African, Asian, and Middle Eastern cultures into his designs. He retired from fashion in 2002 and passed away in 2008, leaving behind a legacy as one of the most important designers in fashion history.

The RIAA headquarters is in Washington, D.C. The RIAA was formed in 1952 and its original mission was to administer recording copyright fees and problems related to piracy. In 2001, the RIAA became known for its aggressive pursuit of copyright infringement lawsuits against individuals who illegally download music through peer-to-peer file sharing networks. The RIAA has also been criticized for its tactics, including suing individuals for large sums of money and for targeting college students and other young people. Despite this criticism, the RIAA continues to be a powerful force in the music industry and has played a significant role in shaping the way music is distributed and consumed in the digital age.

Despite their harsh conditions, the Badlands have been inhabited by humans for thousands of years, with evidence of Native American settlements dating back to the prehistoric era. \"Havana.\".passage: Havana is the capital city, largest city, province, major port, and leading commercial center of Cuba. The city has a population of 2.1 million inhabitants, and it spans a total area of 781.58 km2 (301.77 sq mi) – making it the largest city by area, the most populous city, and the fourth largest metropolitan area in the Caribbean region. The city extends mostly westward and southward from the bay, which is entered through a narrow inlet and which divides into three main harbors: Marimelena, Guanabacoa, and Atarés. The sluggish Almendares River traverses the city from south to north, entering the Straits of Florida a few miles west of the bay. Havana's name is derived from habana, the original name of the city's founding settlement, Habana Vieja (Old Havana). The city's economy is heavily dependent on tourism, with an annual influx of over a million visitors. Havana is also a center for medical research, biotechnology, and pharmaceuticals.
